Title: The Mouse, the Frog, and the Eagle

Vocabulary.Saw: The act of perceiving with the eyes.

Sentences.Text: A little Mouse lived on land.
FunQuestions: Have you ever seen a mouse?
What do you think mice eat?

Sentences.Text: One day, he met a Frog who lived in water.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: How might the Mouse and the Frog become friends?
FunQuestions: Do you think frogs and mice can be friends?

Sentences.Text: The Frog had a mean idea.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Frog’s idea might be?
FunQuestions: What does it mean to be mean?
How would you stop a mean plan?

Sentences.Text: He tied his foot to the Mouse’s foot with a rope.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the Frog tied himself to the Mouse?
FunQuestions: What is a rope used for?
How would you untie a knot?

Sentences.Text: The poor Mouse was pulled into the water too.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think will happen to the Mouse in the water?
FunQuestions: Why do you think the Mouse didn’t want to go into the water?

Sentences.Text: The Mouse’s body came up to the top of the water.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What does it mean when something floats to the top?
FunQuestions: Can you name animals that live in water?

Sentences.Text: An Eagle flying in the sky saw it.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Eagle will do?
FunQuestions: How do eagles see things from so far away?

Sentences.Text: The Eagle came down and picked up the Mouse.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think will happen next?
FunQuestions: Why do eagles pick up small animals?
How strong do you think an eagle’s claws are?

Sentences.Text: The Eagle ate both the Mouse and the Frog.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What is the lesson of this story?
FunQuestions: What other animals do eagles eat?
What would you do if you were the Mouse?
